subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|肉|t1=flesh|干|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}} – a body part.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Probably from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*b-ka-(n/m/ŋ)||bitter; salty; bile; liver}}, in which case it would be related to {{och-l|苦|bitter}}; also compare {{cog|tbq-bdg-pro|*bi-ka||liver}}, whence {{cog|brx|||liver|tr=bi-ka}}, {{cog|grt|bika||liver}}.

Alternatively, {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} compares it with {{cog|sit-pro|*m-kal ~ *s-gal||lower back; kidney}}, whence {{cog|bo|མཁལ་མ|'''མཁལ'''་མ|kidney}}, {{cog|lus|kal||kidney}}, {{cog|cdm|गल्‌||kidney}}, {{cog|my|ခါး||waist}}.
